engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Serve as a natural mechanism for the release of internal pressure within a system to prevent potential explosive build-up of gases and magma.
Structure the system for the eruption of magma, gases, and ash through a vent or fissure in the crust to allow the materials to rise and escape, relieving internal pressure.
Utilize the pressure from accumulating materials beneath the surface to form a conduit, which allows the volcanic materials to rise and escape, ultimately relieving internal pressure.
